abstract: Mississippi men John L Blalack and Robert H Rice plead guilty to violation of federal hate-crime law; they are last two defendants among group of 10 white men accused of racially motivated assaults on African-Americans in Jackson, Miss, in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The two were the last of 10 defendants who have pleaded guilty in racially motivated attacks on African-Americans in Jackson in 2011.
snippet: The two were the last of 10 defendants who have pleaded guilty in racially motivated attacks on African-Americans in Jackson in 2011.

headline.main: Two Mississippi Men Plead Guilty to Hate Crimes
headline.print_headline: Two Mississippi Men Plead Guilty in Hate-Crimes String
